name: Time Clickers
description: Time Clickers is what's called an 'incremental game'. There's always a fun upgrade to look forward to, and the numbers keep getting bigger! Hire a team to fight for you, even when you're offline!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP / Vista / Windows 7 / Windows 8 Memory: 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 150 MB available space

reviews.review_text: It started with AdVenture Capitalist...i got really into that game...then i played click heros.....now this....I need Help  too many clickers too much addiction play this game!
It trains your arm better than fapping. But only for the first 2-4 hours.

It's a clicker game, except you actually have to aim before you click. The graphics is... alright, you shoot 3d cubes, the UI is average, and probably the same as other idle games.  I guess if you like idle games this is nice.

Time Clickers, or a clicker game without P2W options.   Featuring live leaderboards and a comparatively streamlined design, this clicker title offers you fresh new incentives to qualify for a jolly round of carpal tunnel surgery. I know I'm first in line. That Clicker Heroes is a flash game and this one is made in Unity is about the only difference between the two, so don't expect anything revolutionary.  The only downside I could find is that Time Clickers is even more luck-based than any other title in the genre I played, with beating a boss stage often hinging on getting a random gold drop that suddenly allows you to triple your DPS. I'd prefer the game to be slightly more about picking upgrades cleverly than hoping for a kind RNG.
After a straight 12 hours testing session I can say: not addictive at all
Please...let...me...go...to...bed... ;(

This game has me in it's clutches. I miss my Warcraft raids because I'm working my way through waves.  If I had to make a request, it would be for some social aspect, at least a chat for in-gamers. So we could all laugh and console each other in our pit of addiction.  Great game!
This is the game you just leave running over night :) I love it!
Funny and nice game! Enjoy us! :D
Like fapping, but it hurts your arm more
It's a lot of fun, at first... then it goes into a slump, then you give it a little more time... It pays off. Then you get to the 'end', then you play something else.
i like the part where i have to click.  10/10 would macro again
I dont mind the game its fun and it collects gold when your off line i like that it has a lot upgrades and that it has updates for the season to make it more festive i rate this game 9/10
This is the real clicking game where you need to aim instead of letting the DPS do its work. Your DPS can't do ♥♥♥♥.  RIP mouse 2015-2015

This is a great clicker game. Very polished, and free. If you are new to clicker games, just realize that there is no point and its a big time waster.

It's a good clicker game, but don't expect it to be a very good idle progression game. Idle game play is underwhelming to the point you need to be constantly active in the game.  It was fun for a while, but gets boring (much sooner than other clicker games)

This is definitely one of the funner clicker games out there. If you are a clicker game fan then I suggest you try this one out. It has a smooth upgrade system and cool abilities. Not to mention tons of achievements to earn :)   This is one of those clicker games that is very easy to play and progress and not have to spend any money. It doesn't really hold you back in a way where you feel like you need to toss some coin for quick progression.

NOTE: This is a review for a free to Play game as as such, you should not take it or any other review seriously. Play it for yourself, it's better that way. It does costs you nothing after all.  Time Clickers is like Clicker Heroes, only in an FPS perspective, simpler and easier to get into and executed atleast 3 time better.  Let's start with my #1 gripe with Clicker Heroes; Prestiging and Prestige Tokens. This game has those, Time Warps and Time Cubes. Time Warps are only unlocked once you get some Time Cubes and have unlocked every ability. Time Cubes give you a permanent 20% boost to DPS (5 of them gives you a 1x boost and so on for example) and this boost stays if you spend them or not. You can buy things from the ability to start at later waves upon a reset, start with more money upon a reset, or doing a very large variety of things into categories of Gold, Damage, Abilities and Clicks.  You can buff individual weapon's DPS by 100% per upgrade, or you can decrease ability cooldowns. If you want, you can increase how much gold you get per box by buffing gold find, and even you can upgrade the number of time cubes you can get.  These Artifacts, as they're called, have anywhere from a single level to 500 and they're all wonderful, not a isngle one is useless.  Gold is given when you kill cubes which are all that enemies are, jsut a collection of cubes, only you slowly destroys parts of an enemy, effectively de-atmoizing them.  Upgrades are often-appearing, 5 being for every range of 100, and a promotion at 100s to gain access to a new range of upgrades in the next 100 levels.  All of these allow for Time Clickers to essentially have no progression walls, which every other idle game and clicker game has. There's more or less just... slow parts, at which poit you should just time warp and get a higher DPS boost so you can power through it.  The game's progression is only fast if you actively play it and is infact designed around it, many abilities buffing the click pistol in ways that make those abilities the most devastating, such as punchthrough, which allows you to ghost-shoot through an unlimited number of cubes, hitting all of them equally in the same line your shots are in.  The game actually feels rewarding, never will you wonder 'Should I spend my cubes, or jsut hold on to them' since... their bonus is never lost. Ever.  All in all, I could rant and rave about this game for literally hours on end, jsut play it yourself, it is literally like any game similar to it, only it does everything better and... it basically makes Cookie clicker and Clicker Heroes look completely boring.  I give this game a 10/10, it is Legendary, what should be the standard for future Clicker/Idle games. Once I get to the highest point, I shall determine if this recieves Godlike status.  As far as I know, there's no bad parts to this game, nothing to gripe about legitimately.

I apologize for my disorganization and rambling thoughts, I want a sandwhich.  TL;DR - It is a rather short review and if you dont read it, IDC... 8.5/10   After playing some time on this game I would definatly rate it in my top 10 of idle clicker games. Im gonna have to blame Kongregate for why I even have a top 10... they have soo dang many clicker games on their site...  But this game is pretty fun, they did a good job with the ascension feature, in some other games like Adventure Capitalist, and Clicker Heros, it just takes soo dang long to make ascending worth it, but this game I could keep ascending once I get to lvl 100 and feel like Im getting something out of it.  The whole shooting the blocks aspect is really well done, It still keeps to the whole defeat this enemy feature of clicker games but you can get that sense of accomplishment for destroying the individual blocks  Over all I would rate this as an 8 or 9 out of 10.
Better than masturbation :) 11/10

Amazingly satisfying!  I give it 10/10 because by far it is the best clicker game I've been played so far. Good clicker games that applies first-person shooter. I love it!  P/S: Use auto-clicker application Set interval to 1 miliseconds Run game then start pressing the key to activate the auto-click  What you get there son is not just an ordinary gun, IT'S A SOPHISTICATED AUTOMATED GATLING CANNON!!! (plugs ears with fingers)  It's awesome, and you could see that when you set the idle mode on, it works perfectly as I described!! Also sounds like you rain bullets out of an A10 Thunderbird/Warthog main cannon, but it's more of like  an anti-aircraft turret...the one that you saw in the Battleships movie.  Cool, isn't it?  Reached to Level 106 in just 2 hours. Hehehe!!

This game is really fun for the first like what? 7 hours? Now this game is a clicker game, which basically clicking on simple things and upgrading your clicks and automatic clickers to become stronger and get even more op ♥♥♥♥. Now this game is so exception, this is a solid clicker game, but it is an idle first person shooter too. Though don't think the FPS part is high tense. Its just shooting blocks which is fine, but if you want to get far with this game you will have to spend time upgrading the automatic or your 'team'. What's fun about this game is that the music is good, and its rewarding when you destroy blocks. I also really love that their is no paywall in this game and the first 7 hours is just addicting. The upgrades feel well done and everything just felt rewarding. And then I finished 100 waves: and then they introduced 'time warps'. Now its a smart idea in concept. When you beat 100 waves you have the option to go back to start and your upgrade process but in return you get 'time blocks' (or something like that I forgot the name), With these blocks you can buy perks that will stay with you forever. And thats how you complete the game, play the game up to wave 100, start again with everything slightly different. And thats when I gave up, I mean what's the point of that?. But this game is still positive for a reason, this game is free and asks nothing; also the file is only 30 mb. So if I spent 7 hours of my time here and had fun? Why the ♥♥♥♥ not recommend this game so you guys can have fun for 7 hours?
Shooting'n Target Shooting

This game is pretty fun if you don't mind clicking ... A LOT! It gives me something to do when I have time so I don't mind it. Although my fingers can get tired after a while but its pretty addicting. I keep saying I will go for ..one ...more ..round.

I LOVE THIS GAME  BUT  hear me out, it's not a bad review, there's just a bug, that takes away a lot of the fun once you reach close to the 'end game process'  there seems to be a bug where i cant get ANY time cubes. im supposed to have 14 by now but it still says 0  time cubes are what makes this more interesting than other clicker games, since you have a choice of upgrading abilities and such, ( damage, speed, gold earned etc. ) and a branching system   its a very straight forward game, fun and easy but i can't recommend this until this bug is fixed, it takes away a lot of the experience  once this is fixed, ( and poping you could change guns too would be implemented ) this would be the epic version of clicker heroes   wahaha   EDITED  it seems you have to time warp first before you could spend the cubes. sad me is sad :|  awesome game still.

I seriously need to quit downloading these clicking games.  That being said, the presentation on this one is slick and the fact that you actually have to aim and cannot just blindly click makes it pretty entertaining. As a CLICKER game goes, this is really quite good.  No micro transactions, fair ability cooldowns and at least has a little bit of change in how it looks. Top it off with being free. If you just want a little game to check out every now and then, this is definetely good. The complete lack of microtransactions is really what seals it.  If you want to compare this to most GAMES, then you'll be let down. But that's not a fair comparison.  It's not a game, game. It's a clicker game. And as a clicker game I reccomend it.

So much more fun than clicker heroes. Don't have to spend hours on the reddit or wiki trying to figure out how to get anywhere. No horribly complicated calculations. The time cubes (Hero Souls in CH) act like talent points in rpgs but you never lose the DPS bonus when you buy the talents. This means you are always getting stronger. You can never make yourself weaker by spending points early. I am sure there is a optimum path to upgrade through, but it does not matter that much compared to Clicker Heroes.  Oh just a tip. For your first several runs, time warp as soon as you can. Level 100 gets you 10 time cubes. Levels 105, 110, 115, 120 get you you 3-4 time cubes. But getting to past 110 takes a little while at first.
Good game if you want to do nothing all the time and still feel like doing something.

I was shown this and got mesmerised. After a few minutes of playing, the achievements started popping up. That was it. I was hooked. I can be a bit of a completionist sometimes, and I like achievements. So even now, almost 400 hours in, I still leave it running in the background when I'm doing uni work. I will have those achievements, one day...

Let me start by saying that not only is this game free, but there are NO MICROTRANSACTIONS!  I have lost a lot of hours to these free clicker games. It started with AdVenture Capitalist and then Clicker Heroes. Time Clickers is my favorite by far out of these. All the other clickers seem to just want you to check in and play them for a few minutes and then leave them alone. With TC I actually want to stay in the game and play it.  The biggest difference with this game is the fact that you're not just clicking on things to kill them, you have a gun that shoots cubes to destroy them. Different colored cubes have different ammounts of health. You get to hire more shooters and upgrade them as well as yourself. There are is a mini boss every 5 levels and a main boss every 10. After defeating any type of boss the game will activate any special abilities you have unlocked for free and let you used them for 30 seconds. Every 100 levels you get Time Cubes. These are the main objective, you use them to permanently increase stats that persist over the course of your game after your resets. Even after you spend them, you still get a 10% DPS bonus for each cube.  I think they thing I love most is that the enemies are built out of cubes. You can see from watching the video how everything looks, you shoot the enemy and slowly chip away at it. I can't begin to tell you how satistying this is, it's what keeps me in the game and actually playing it. I really feel like they want you to play and have fun, not just mess with the game for awhile and then let it idle or only check it a few times a day.   I did my first reset after only a few hours of playing, with most other clicker games, this may take DAYS. If I stayed in the game, I think I could probably do it this time in 30 minutes or so. If you're a fan of these games at all, and you want to feel like you're not wasting your life clicking your way to carpel tunnel, then play Time Clickers.

This is my 4th Clicker game, and it really is the first of the 2nd generation of Clicker games!  Targeted Clicker game! You have to aim at different bricks, you cant just click anymore, you also have to hit them.... thats why you use guns in this game.  Sounds like a small thing, but really chances the whole game, great thing! Also nice graphics!  Also, there are some decisions differnt to other Clicker games; The Time Cubes you earn, in contrast to other clicker games, always count towards DPS once activated... even if you use them for upgrading of skills... this makes every run count... as you at least get stronger! Makes the mid to end game a bit easier to grind through...  The concept of differently colored blocks, which are worth different amounts of gold is also very clever!  Soon, there will be IDLE mode (currently you only gain very little money, but you dont progress in levels)... NIce achievements give you a reason to get going and continue. And most importantly, its really F2P.. there is no store, you cant buy anything... just beat the game fair!  9/10.

Time Clickers is an incremental clicker/idle game.  Click to deal damage to blocks, eventually breaking them and earning some cash. Spend that cash on upgrades to your click damage. Purchase automatic damage over time, and upgrade that. Unlock special skills and use them to defeat enemies faster, or earn more cash per kill, and invest that cash into more upgrades so you can kill faster and get more cash to invest so you can kill faster and get more cash to invest so you can kill faster and get more cash to invest so you can kill faster and get more cash to invest so you can kill faster and get more cash to invest so you can kill faster and get more cash to invest...  Yep. It's one of these types of games. There's a prestige system that gives you a special currency that you can use to purchase various powerups that do a lot of things, such as decreasing skill cooldowns, increase gold dropped, increase dps,  To many people, this type of game seems boring. To those people, I'd suggest peeking at a few games like this to see what the appeal is. It's basically a distillation of most game genres that have some form of upgrade system, such as obtaining better gear or gaining levels and powerful perks.  Personally, I like these types of games. They satisfy that reward center in the brain. It's a perfect example of the Skinner Box.

almost self-playing game

Normally, I find clicker games to be very calming. I have a lot of anxiety issues, and the simple mechanics and repetitive nature of clicker games gives me something to do that doesn't require a lot of brainpower.  Time Clickers is not like the other clicker games I have played.  First off, if you have photo-sensitive epilepsy, skip this game. Even when I used the simplest, most low-res graphics and animation options I could find in the menu, there was so much going on and so many flashing colors that I actually found myself feeling more stressed as I played. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but I wasn't prepared for it, and like I said, if you have photo-sensitive epilepsy, it's probably not a good game for you.  Still, I like the idea of this game. Aside from the cosmetic differences, it is pretty much just like any other clicker game I've played. The damage bonuses and special upgrades are structured a little differently than I'd seen before, but it was easy enough to figure out. If you want a nice time-waster and don't mind the hectic, super-bright graphics, go ahead and pick it up. Personally, I'll be sticking to my more sedate clicker games, but it's really a personal preference thing.

This game costs you no money at all. But playing this will cost you a lot of time. If you enjoy idle clicker games, this is one of the very best in that category.  This is very easy to pick up and play. Upgrade your weapon and your team's weapons using gold that you gather by shooting down enemy cubes, collect time cubes at higher levels, then reset back to level 1, buy upgrades using the time cubes you collected, progress faster and easier, redo these steps a few more times, get to higher levels to collect weapon cubes for even better upgrades, and by the time you realize, you would have wasted a LOT of hours. Then reset back to a lower level and start playing again with a lot of power at your disposal.  I just nominated this game for a 'Rescue me from this game' award.
well, what else can I say about this game, is fun and addictive so check it out and play it

Time trap. You know, Big Time.  Time Clickers, obviously, is one of those infamous clicker games, that gathered so much interest in the last year. And when I just started with Time Clickers, it felt really, really different from the others. Like some FPS-scrolling game, where you don't see blood and don't really kill anything. And it reminded me of the Hogan Alley for NES, mode C, where you were shooting cans with your light gun... Boy, that was fun back in early 90s! But, after the third hundred of hours in 'Time Clickers' passed by, I have to notice, this one is wrong at some point too. I don't see problem spending that much time on some strategy like Civilization or Europa Universalis... but clicker game?  Okay, I'll admit, the math behind this game is much more fair, than in case of 'Clicker Heroes'. We have on the plate: very good visuals, quite original system of grading and levelling... coming from the free-ware project... And only one (but big) downside. To prosper there, you're really supposed to click above 75 million times, crushing some cubes... C'mon, it is not that fun after second thousand of clicks, but this game expect you to go on, and on, and on... Out of the whole variety of clicker games, the one which is not trying to get all my gaming time is the AdventureCapitalist - so far, the only game which works just as supposed from that generic 'idling' genre. As of Time Clickers... I ended up being disappointed and frustrated, like 'where is the end of this thing?' You may laugh at me, but I bet you probably never were stuck walking in the unknown environment for so long, that you have to fall asleep, defenseless against possible critters and other things. Try to get lost in taiga or desert for couple of days, would ya? Bear Grylls style? And when you'll survive, I'd like to talk to you again, about reason behind playing hundreds of hours in clicker games.  Overall mark for game 6.8/10 - it is quite good, for a clicker, really. But not a thing I'd recommend to anyone around.

The word Time in Time Clickers refers to what you will need to spend to get to any high level, because it will take years!!! At first I loved this game: Very relaxing and fun to play with a good song under it. After playing it for weeks on end though, it's become so frustrating I felt like frisbeeing my iPad into the nearest concrete wall. I played without any cheats. Finally, after weeks and weeks of being stuck, playing over 10 hours on most days, I had had enough and continued on PC at 20-50x speed with Cheat Engine just to get a little further I thought optimistically. I was also curious how much longer it would take to get any progress. Here are the facts: After playing actively for about 20 hours at 20-50x speed, continuing from my game on iPad (synced it), I've played the equivalent of at least 400 hours, or 40 days of playing 10 hours straight. That's more than a month, working weekends and with overtime each day! And you know what I got? 60 levels, or 4% further than before! Okay, I could get a lot further, but this was so slow, I got more time cubes restarting the time-line and you need time-cubes to get better and go further in the next time-line. Time-cube gains (artifacts) were all maxed out, so I was increasing as much as I possibly could. And since the game gets slower and slower as you reach higher levels, it will probably take tens of thousands of hours to get much further as it takes exponentially more time. That is thousands of ascentions back to low level, hardly getting any further for all your effort. Hell, it's even tedious at 20-50x speed! A whole day active playing for 4% increase? SUMMARY: You either put years into this game, playing hours per day, or you cheat and even then it is INCREDIBLY slow. NOT recommended!

I would really like a candid explanation from the developers of this game as to the reasoning behind increasing enemy health over resets. The purpose of resetting is to increase your damage to push farther. When that is ofset by the fact that you are increasing enemy health, which I have proof of, then I really have to question what it is that you want your players to do. I am glad that this game did not monetize to me, but I want my time back.
